comment.text:
Date night was such a wonderful experience! Hal's has a very warm, cozy atmosphere. We actually went to the movies first, and ended up finishing well before our reservation. We decided to go to the restaurant early and just to see if they would accommodate us. And wouldn't you know, they did so within a matter of 20 minutes. In mind you we were about an hour and 15 minutes early. So I greatly appreciated that.

The staff was absolutely warm, welcoming, very attentive, and courteous. They even had a lot of musician playing on the ivories, which was a really really nice touch. I enjoyed that. He had a really good playlist of songs that catered to all. And the food, it was very very good, our steak was perfectly seasoned perfectly cooked and we thoroughly enjoyed it. The spinach was delicious as well, but , we weren't impressed with the salad nor were we impressed with the grilled asparagus. They were very basic. But everything else was really good!

photos.caption: Grilled Asparagus, Sauteed Spinach & Prime Bone - in Ribeye Oz .

comment.text:
Hals truly delivered an exceptional evening, and it all began with the attentive service of our host, Phillip (who, incidentally, bears a striking resemblance to Chris Pratt).

We embarked on a delightful wine journey under Phillip's guidance, as he deftly tailored our selections to our preferences, making each glass a new discovery.

The A5 wagyu beef sampler was a highlight--four ounces of sheer indulgence that practically dissolved on the tongue. It was a challenge to resist ordering seconds (or thirds) of this heavenly creation.

Next up were the escargot, a garlicky, buttery delight that set the tone for the feast to come. Alongside, we sampled oysters that were fresh, briny, and a perfect precursor to the evening's festivities.

Our main courses were a carnivore's dream lineup: cowboy steaks, a tender filet, and sides that were just as memorable, crispy brussels sprouts and delicious potatoes. 

In conclusion, Hals offers an exceptional dining experience that balances superb service with culinary artistry. If you find yourself craving an unforgettable night filled with outstanding wines, succulent meats, and a touch of unexpected delight, look no further than Hals. You'll leave with a satisfied palate and a desire to return for more.

Excellent service, food quality and ambience. Only valet parking, and need reservation. High-end place for special dinners. Went on a working day but the place was completely full. 
Appetizers were super great  - oyster bordelaise, escargot, lobster lighted tower, fried calamari 
Entree - Scottish Atlantic Salmon fillet - cooked with perfection along with Cesar salad, could hear yummy ooo's on prime bone-in ribeye with lobster tail 
Fresh squeezed orange juice was refreshing. 
Side dishes - super super good - Brussels sprouts, lobster Mac and cheese, Brabant potato's, sautéed mushrooms.

photos.caption: Lobster White Truffle Macaroni And Cheese, Brussels, Brabant Potatoes,
Orange juice and fried calamari topped with  crab

comment.text: My wife and I enjoyed an excellent upscale meal at Hal's. Our server, Miguel, was attentive but not over bearing. The food was perfectly cooked and it was a great way to end a busy work day.

photos.caption: Blackened steak medallions, onion rings and sautéed mushrooms

comment.text:
Hal's never disappoints! Food is always amazing and service impeccable! It can get a little noise but well worth it for the excellent meal! The steaks are always cooked and seasoned to perfection ! 
Be sure and make reservations it gets busy !

It was my 1st time at Hal's for a fancy girls night out & wow was I impressed! 
The second you walk in, you see a pianist playing, older gentlemen smoking cigars (downstairs is smoking upstairs no smoking). The vibe is so classy & intimate. 
The garlic bread they bring out is amazing! 
We ordered the seafood tower to share & it was honestly very filling: lump crabmeat, ousters, shrimp, lobster, so yummy! 
I ordered the snapper as well as espresso martini, both were fabulous! 
The servers are so attentive & sweet. Definitely coming back!

If you're looking for upscale dining in Atlanta then this is it! We were invited to join a few of my colleagues for dinner and the experience was top tier from start to finish! Hal's does steak right. The steak was lightly seasoned, charred, and cooked to perfection no steak sauce needed. The fried lobster was delicious also. The sides were huge so we decided to share. Creamy spinach, Mashed potatoes, and Lobster Mac n cheese were very tasty as well. All noteworthy additions to any meal. Even though the place was packed service was great. Our waiter gave us a tiramisu dessert on the house and then asked me was I ready for the "damage report" referring to the bill. That was the best laugh I've had in a while. But he was right and next time we'll be sure to label this one as a "business meeting" lol. 

Valet parking available for $5 
Business casual dress code for men. No athletic gear.

Enjoy

We had an amazing experience at Hal's. We went for a date night and started at the bar with 2 dirty martinis. They were wonderful. At our reservation time we were seated upstairs and greeted by our waiter who was wonderful. We ordered a bottle of red and began with the calamari. It was so good. Tender and fried to perfection. Their garlic bread was great too. We enjoyed the 12 ounce filet split and shared the Brussels and white truffle lobster mac and cheese. Everything was perfectly cooked and tasted amazing. We finished with the tiramisu which was made well. Couldn't have asked for a better date night dinner and we've been to all the greats in Atlanta. Make sure you add this one to your list.

Hal's is always a great steakhouse choice in Atlanta no matter the occasion. This has become one of my favorite steakhouses over the last year in the area and it is always consistent and never misses. The service is phenomenal, food is consistently good, and ambiance great. 

They do have Valet Parking available which is great for this area ($5). Gentleman you must be dressed correctly (check the dress code), however you will have an amazing time!

For this trip, I had an old fashion and a Manhattan for my drinks which were A1! For food, I had the Mac n cheese, Brussels, skinny onion straws and the 22 oz bone in rib eye (cooked medium).

Everything was seasoned and cooked to perfection. Steak was a little over cooked for medium, but still great. 

Again, the consistency here has kept me returning and not wanting to try new steakhouses! Highly recommend trying out this staple in atlanta!

Hal's is consistently a great experience with great food. The regular menu is good, but I recommend getting the chef specials. You will not be disappointed. This place is an Atlanta staple so the decor isn't modern, but that's what adds to the character. The wine list is extensive and the service is 5 star. Be prepared to spend $250-$300 for an exceptional dinner for two with at least one bottle of wine. You could go cheaper, and do just fine as well. I will always love this place.

My husband & I dined here on a Monday night for a date night. The service was wonderful & our waiter could not have been any more patient & line to us. He was very knowledgeable of the menu & gave us great recommendations. We both enjoyed wine & it paired great with our meal. We ordered the beef carpaccio for an appetizer & it was phenomenal. Melt in your mouth type of quality. I order the sea bass special & my husband got the filet. We did a side of potatoes & brussel sprouts. My husband ordered the chocolate cake for dessert and loved it. It was very rich. Highly highly recommend Hal's! Probably the best steak in Atlanta! My husband raved to his friends for days about how much he enjoyed it. The only thing I would change is the smoking - it does smell smokey when you first walk in.

photos.caption: Our dinner spread! Sea bass & a Filet Mignon 12 Oz .

comment.text:
Wonderful dining experience!  Arrived to celebrate a birthday. We got there about 10 minutes early for our reservation but they seated us right away.  Sat in the upstairs dining room. Our table was right across from the ac vent and when we mentioned it was cold, our waiter Jonas had them lower the temperature right away. Much appreciated!

We ordered a bottle of wine with our meal. They brought out complimentary bread basket which was sliced garlic bread. Yum!
Started with the appetizer special of fried lobster medallions in a butter creme sauce. We then moved to both sizes of the ribeyes.  We shared sides of lobster Mac and onion rings. Be aware that the steaks come with a small side already so we should have only gotten one more to share because with the steaks and other sides we ordered there was way too much food. Everything was delicious!!  Steaks done perfectly to temp. The creamed spinach was awesome and onion rings omg!  The lobster Mac was the only thing I had an issue with. Creamy and cheesy but the only lobster to be found was the lobster tail garnish on the dish. Not a single piece to be found in the whole dish :/. 

Service was excellent and attentive, thanks Jonas! We then had the cheesecake and crème brûlée desserts.  The one thing that took away from the experience was the noise level.  We were seated on upstairs patio and could barely hear each other across the table, a small two top. This took a bit away from the ambiance of the place. We could hear all the conversations at nearby tables as it seemed folks were shouting to be heard. 
Overall, we enjoyed the meal and the experience.

photos.caption: Lobster Mac and cheese and Hal 's Ribeye Oz .

comment.text: Food was amazing fitting for the eclectic environment white table cloth restaurant. Staff was professional and the food was great.

First time at Hal's and I already cannot wait to go back. We have THE best service, Eddie waited on us and he was a perfect gem. We split the 12oz and got side dishes to split. Everything was cooked to perfect. The steak was amazing, of course. But if the lobster Mac is available, definitely get it. The cool dark vibes made it great for conversation and catching up with my friend. Couldn't recommend this place more.

This is one of the top Steakhouses in Atlanta. I absolutely love the ambiance here and the food is amazing. They have valet available but I always Uber. This is the perfect place for a birthday diner or any special occasion. The service is amazing and our waiters are always knowledgeable about the food and drink menu. They also have the best recommendations if you're undecided. I def recommend you to try them out
Great food. Great experience. Steak was really well cooked. The service staff was really well versed in the menu and provided great service.

Hakan was our server and he was great. Service was solid and overall a decent steakhouse in some regards. Pretty much all the typical steakhouse options. 

I normally write more thorough reviews, but I'm going to save a little time tonight. 

If you are serious about steak and a fine meal, this could be an option, but there are better options. If you want to see a bunch of hookers and smoke cigars...this is your place. Downstairs is more of a lounge for some dudes looking for a hookup with working ladies. Upstairs is for dining and such, but just doesn't meet the cut versus other options. 

Perfectly nice place with two different atmospheres  (upstairs and downstairs). Just not my vibe. 

It's an Atlanta institution so if you live in Atlanta you should check it off your list. And if you are an old rich dude looking for a gold digger that will end up finishing her night later at Johnnie's Hideaway, go blow $500 at Hal's. 

For a date night.......maybe go somewhere else.

The staff the staff the staff!!!   I've been around a bunch and when a place makes you feel welcomed and appreciated.  You come back.  Yes it's a bit pricey. But the food was fantastic.  And the experience just makes you want to come back

9/27/23:  

Dear Sammy and the Hal's Team,

I wanted to take a moment to express my heartfelt gratitude for the remarkable response we received following our recent visit to Hal's. As you may recall, our initial experience was marred by an unfortunate incident that left us deeply disappointed.

However, the next evening, we were pleasantly surprised when Sammy, one of the owners of Hal's, reached out to us personally. Sammy not only offered a sincere apology but also took the time to thoroughly investigate the situation. He reviewed video footage, consulted with staff, and engaged in a thoughtful conversation with us, listening attentively for over half an hour to our feedback, which he carefully noted.

During our conversation, we emphasized the importance of a more measured and discreet approach when addressing issues related to attire, especially in situations where there might be ambiguity. We suggested that assessing the situation calmly and consulting with management first would be a more considerate approach, and Sammy wholeheartedly agreed. He even mentioned that he would bring this valuable insight to the next staff meeting to ensure such incidents are handled better in the future.

In addition to addressing our concerns, Sammy showed incredible compassion and understanding regarding my partner's health condition. He went above and beyond by sending a stunning bouquet of flowers with a personal note to my partner.  This gesture touched our hearts deeply.

We are genuinely appreciative of Sammy's dedication to making immediate changes to the dress policy and improving the way such situations are managed. It's evident that Hal's is committed to ensuring every guest receives the respect and consideration they deserve.

We now look forward with anticipation to revisiting Hal's in the near future, not only to experience your renowned cuisine but also to say hello to Sammy and, hopefully, meet Mr. Hal himself.

Thank you once again for your swift and compassionate response. It has truly turned our initial disappointment into a positive and hopeful experience.

Warm regards, Matt

photos.caption: Extremely kind gesture from Sammy and the team at Hal's

comment.text:
Came here on a Friday night. You need to call ahead and set reservations because this place fills up quick and it is difficult to get seating. They also have free valet parking.

The service is spectacular. The waiter took care of all of our needs. 

I are the toasted bread, calamari, NY strip, cream spinach, and bread pudding. The bread is decent but should come with butter. The calamari is fried perfectly and comes with a nice marinara sauce. The NY strip was cooked to perfection and perfectly seasoned. I have never had a steak where every bite was just as delicious as the last bite. The creamed spinach was decent. Bread pudding came out on a hot plate and was delicious. I was stuffed.

I made a reservation at Hal's over a month in advance.  I'm not sure how late you can still make one, but they were quite crowded when we dined there on a Saturday, so my advice is to book early.

We arrived around 6 p.m.  They feature valet parking in a short loop in front of the restaurant. Note also that when you leave the restaurant, you cannot really turn right (towards Piedmont Ave.) as Old Ivy Road dead-ends just before that for some reason. 

You enter via a ramp from the valet station. They had a security guy manning the door when we got there, though the area didn't seem unsafe by any measure.  Maybe they have a fair percentage of rich diners and they just want to discourage any sort of 'invasive' robbery...

When you enter, you are facing an elevator up to the 2nd floor. Turn left instead to the host station.  The interior or the restaurant here was very dark.  Maybe it was just the transition from the bright sunlight outside to this interior, but as we were led up the stairs beyond the elevator, I had to take it slow and pay close attention to even see the stairs.  We ended up circling around to a sort of windowed balcony on the 2nd floor, which was quite light and airy (especially compared to the stairs). 

The overall vibe I got was 'money'.  This is a relatively expensive restaurant, and the clientele seemed to reflect that.  There was significant percentage of 'old money' looking tables, along with a mix of families celebrating graduations, and younger tables of people gathering for whatever.  There were a few couples like us as well. 

Service was swift and efficient, as tends to be the case in places like this. There is no shortage of servers and they tend to combine on a table the way pit crews handle formula 1 cars (in a generally good way).  

We both got the filets, where were both large, expensive, and a good cut of meat cooked very well. There are a few 'standard' side dishes also, though you can up-change them.  We both liked our mashed potatoes, though the portions there were more modest compared to the steaks. We split a salad which turned out to be a good idea, as even split we each had plenty.  We also split a dessert, which was also large. 

As for drinks, they appeared to have an extensive wine menu.  I heard an adjoining table negotiating for what sort of scotch they would get in their cocktail, and the list seemed to go on for a while.  So I you are in to higher end spirits, this may also be the place for you.

This may have just been related to where we got seated or the nearby tables, but by the end of the meal the noise level had ramped up significantly.  It had been much quieter at the outset. I'm not sure which noise level is the norm. 

Overall, we both liked our meals here quite a bit.  It is certainly not a place that we'd go on a whim, but for a rare splurge meal, this is a great option.

While Hal's is usually a staple for us in terms of absolutely great food all the time, we were slightly disappointed on our last visit due to the chopped salad. It is not really salad at all; it is finally chopped celery and carrot mixed in with lettuce that is also very finely minced. However, what surprised me the most was that after we told the waiter that the chopped salad was not at all what we expected, and that we did not really like it, the waiter did not offer to take it back or replace it with another salad. I would've really thought he would do that. So, it was disappointing service-wise. Luckily, the lobster bites were terrific as always, and the blackened filet mignon was delicious.

Busy Tuesday
Host and servers were great. We did have a reservation but it was packed & waited 20 min for opening. 
Food was good. 
I probably should have done wine this time. 
Valet parking. 
Would def come back but hopefully it isn't so busy and lively next time.

I'm leaving 4 stars.  I do meals like this in different cities all the time. In Atlanta, I've dined at a number of traditional steak houses and found this one to be the least impressive. No one in my party had steak, I tried to order steak, but my waiter actually talked me out of it. I don't believe he meant to, but my roast chicken was quite good. Good sides with the Lobster Mac, Brussels, mashed potatoes.  Louisiana style oysters were also good. It's difficult to have too much garlic. Speaking of garlic the bread was really good. Drinks were ok, old fashioned's were not well mixed and we ordered plenty lol. Nothing special but good meal at typical prices for a place like this.

This restaurant was ok. The steak and mashed potatoes were amazing . The duck on other hand was so salty i couldn't eat a-lot. They must of brimmed it way too long. The dessert was incredible and tasted so good! 

Our waiter was also so nice and kind. Thank you for making my wife's birthday special.

OMG! Probably one of the best steakhouses in Atlanta no doubt. Food & services was a win for me. 

Food:
Char grilled oysters (appetizer)- this app was good but not the best oysters I've had. I believe the cheese on top was baked too long and made the oysters had a burnt taste to it but I will give them a pass since this is not a seafood restaurant.

Snapper franchaise- so flavorful, cooked just right and the lemon butter sauce was a great addition.

Prime bone in rib-eye- recommend by server since it was both me and my boyfriends first time and I must say one of the best steaks he has ever eaten. Very flavorful, tender and melts right in your mouth.

Sides- Ordered broccoli and white truffle mac & cheese. When food came out they accidentally gave us two more additional sides which was mashed potatoes and their spaghetti. A lot of upscale restaurants don't make broccoli good but this broccoli was perfectly cooked. Mac and cheese was excellent especially even with them using white cheese. The spaghetti was surprisingly good and the mashed potatoes were just ok I will pass on them but can't complain about when they were free.

The server Hakan was absolutely the best and very attentive to us even with how tight the restaurant seating is.

We will definitely be back.

Service excellent 
Food scrumptious 
Wine list full of interesting choices.   Recommend sitting upstairs.

Hal's was a wonderful experience! Our waiter, Bobby, was a Hal's veteran and was very helpful in making menu selections. My sister lived in Buckhead for many years and said go to Hal's, you won't be disappointed. She was spot on. Everything from service, timing of our food, and quality was superb. We had the oyster and crab meat appetizer, filet, ribeye, mashed potatoes, macaroni and cheese, and chocolate cake. My only complaint was the mac and cheese. It lacked seasoning but everything else was delicious. Next time we are in Atlanta, we will be back!

The chicken was a 10/10 seasoned to perfection, crispy skin on the outside juicy on the inside. Portion was great, they give you 2 large breast and drum. My husband was in love with the duck, it was his first time trying duck & now every restaurant we visit he's looking for something with duck on the menu lol. Hal's set the bar high! Service was great our server was very knowledgeable.

Came here for our anniversary dinner and we're pleasantly surprised by the number of people there on a Monday. We were happy about it though because we were nervous it'd be dead which wouldn't be as fun of an atmosphere. We were wrong though - the ambience was perfect! The garlic bread was delicious as well as the wine. I was surprised the glasses of wine were decently affordable - especially for having over a 4.0 on vivino! My husband ordered the 22 oz bone-in ribeye so I decided to get the trout with lump crabmeat since it was a little more affordable than the steak and I knew he wouldn't be able to eat all 22 ounces. The steak was definitely better than the trout but that's expected - sort of wish I had opted for a pasta dish instead. For sides we ordered the mashed potatoes and creamed spinach - both were fantastic. We were planning on ordering dessert but were way too full by the end of our meal. Even if you don't want to pay the price of the steak but want the upscale environment, I think this is a great place to go because you can order a pasta for under $30 and a glass of wine for about $11.

The food is usually great! Sometimes they miss on following the servers notes. I enjoy my steak with little to no char and although they get it spot on 75% of the time, the other 25% forces me to send it back. They have an appetizer, lobster lebeaux... AMAZING! Usually go with the ribeye and lobster tail. The restaurant is a bit noisy but not noisy enough to deter me from dining. The service is always great as well!

photos.caption: Lobster tail and Prime Bone - in Ribeye Oz .
Fettuccine Alfredo Pasta with lump crab added, Hal 's Ribeye Oz . Accompanied by shrimp and lobster tail
Shrimp Alfredo, Prime Bone - in Ribeye

comment.text: We love birthday's over here! We came here for a friends birthday dinner and everything was amazing. When we arrived we were quickly greeted by valet and shown the front door to walk in. Once inside we spoke with the host to get checked in while we waited for the rest of our group and everyone was very friendly. Once everyone arrived, we were walked upstairs to our table. There was a live band on site this night and they have speakers connected around the restaurant so you are able to hear it from anywhere which was nice. Now, on to the food! We knew we made the right choice when the bread and butter came out to the table and it was hot and delicious; our server kept this coming for us! We tried a variety of different menu items around the table; we started with the oysters and the lobster bites (8/10). For entrees we tried the lobster mac 7/10 and the oven roasted chicken over mashed potatoes (8/10). We will be back for sure!

Hal's was a very unique experience; I came here for an anniversary dinner and we had reservations so we were seated quickly. Our server was wonderful - funny, kind, and helpful. 

We did not start with any appetizers and just had the bread with butter which I enjoyed a lot. For the main course I got a bone in filet au povre and my partner got the filet Cajun style. Such tender meat & great flavors just exploding in my mouth. 

They also had fresh Maine lobster that night so we split a lobster tail that was steamed with a butter lemon sauce. For sides - the mashed potatoes are AMAZING! Since it was our anniversary, we got a little dessert on the house which was a cheesecake with fresh strawberry compote on top. 

The atmosphere was very interesting, dim lighting and loud-ish music, people smoking cigars at the bar, lots of business folks around having meals. 

I enjoyed the experience and would like to come back again soon!

Where do I begin about Hal's? What an unbelievable experience this past week...first lived the vibe of this place and felt like walking right back into 50s-60's steakhouse.  This place was packed on a Tuesday night which tells me this place must be something special. 

Another thing have to shout out before I get into the food is the staff. From the front door, to the table, bussers and waiters these folks are not only super friendly but they hustle. The busyness of the restaurant was impressive but was more impressive is how hard the men and women of Hals work. I didn't mention above and should've included but the bartenders and cooks crank out the food and drinks despite how busy. 

For food I will start off and say that everything was amazing from start to finish and I will try and capture what I can. A little pre-warning even though the garlic bread they drop off on the table is amazing don't dive to deep because this could be a meal wrecker. We started off with the fried lobster, calamari and some oysters. First the fried lobster was life changing the smokiness of flavor combined with the lobster was outstanding. The calamari was perfectly cooked and the homemade sauce was truly remarkable. Then the oysters from Canada tasted so fresh and couldn't resist having a few extra.  

For dinner I had the special bone in filet and it was really special.  The flavors that the attached none brought out where simply amazing and yes I put aside my pride and ate some of that meat right off the bone while boxing up the rest for a buddies dog. We also enjoyed in order and I will rank. 
1) Lobster Mac 5 star 
2) Cream Spinach 4 star 
3) Truffle Mac 5 star 
4) Brussel sprouts 5 star magical 

Now after eating and being in a slight meat coma my friends wanted desert and the only thing we said was you pick and bring out your favorites. Our desert was the equivalent of a seafood tower. It was filled with all sorts delicious selections including ice cream, tiramisu, 2 cheese cakes, bread pudding and some chocolate desert that everyone raved about. 

All in all this was an amazing experience and couldn't say enough compliments on what a great time we all had at Hal's...if your in Atlanta and don't try out Hal's your missing out on an experience you won't forget.

photos.caption: It's hard to explain how amazing this fried lobster  is
I only posted this while delicious this could be a meal wrecker how good it is
Fried calamari with housemade dipping sauce
Desert platter had to pick what was best
Bone in filet mignon so delicious cooked perfectly

comment.text: So I almost don't want to post this Atlanta gem because I don't want it overrun lol BUT this is MY FAVORITE place to dine in Atlanta. Although it's $$$$ it is the one place that constantly is worth it. We dined for my beau's birthday and had reservations (recommended). I love that we dined early (5:30pm) because it was not loud and not crowded, though the place was packed by the time we left. Our server, Kevin Schiltz was AMAZING, and we basically entrusted our entree and wine selection to him and he could not have chosen better. Do not miss the fact that these servers are PROFESSIONAL, jazzing build stellar decades long careers. You will want for nothing and the ambience and decor still gives me old NYC steakhouse. The cocktails are unrivaled and the wine list is certain to have something to your liking. We ordered the bone-in filet special and BLT Wedge special. Also ordered the Escargot, bone-in ribeye and lobster-truffle Mac (special). Enjoyed every moment of this meal. Will be back again when an occasion arises.

photos.caption: Lobster White Truffle Macaroni And Cheese
The BEST filthy martini & Old Fashioned

comment.text:
We had a dinner reservation for 2 at 7:00 pm on Monday, 10/24/22. Jonas was our waiter and he was wonderful! Service was great. They allow smoking at the bar downstairs, but upstairs is smoke-free. There was a wide range of people - people on dates, large parties, and business-people. The food was super good!

We each got an appetizer, a steak (comes with a small side of creamed spinach, mashed potatoes, and one other choice - it was the perfect size!), two sides, and dessert. We had so much leftover. We easily each got 2 meals out of it. If we came with more people next time, I would get the sides, but for just 2, it's unnecessary. Here's what we got:
- Beef Steak Tomato and Onion Salad ($10.95): Good, but not crazy good that you need to get it.
- Shrimp Remoulade ($14.95): My husband enjoyed this!
- Hal's Ribeye 20 oz. ($71.95): My husband loved this!! He got the creamed spinach and said it was the best he's ever had. I'm normally not a huge fan of creamed spinach, but I went back for more!
- Filet Mignon 12 oz. ($66.95): Super good! The flavor was amazing. The crispness on the outside was perfection. I got the mashed potatoes as my side and they were sooo good.
- White Truffle Macaroni and Cheese ($12): I love mac and cheese, and while this was good, I don't think it's a must-order for 2 people. If you have more people in your party to split it with, then go for it.
- Brussels ($12): Suuuuper good. I would definitely recommend this.
- Chocolate Cake ($9.95): We wished this was more like chocolate lava cake. It wasn't warm like we wanted it to be. Still tasted good!

We enjoyed Hal's! We recommend and would also go back ourselves. Some of the best steak we've had in Atlanta.

photos.caption: Beef Steak Tomato And Onion Salad

comment.text:
The service team we had was delightful. 5 Stars
The Salmon and Filet were very good.  5 Stars
Wine options creative!! 4.5 Stars

Dress code standard we understood, called a head and complied with what we learned. 

Our experience "seeing too much"   1 Star - or you could view its as a free floor show called "Beyond Buckhead Bizarre" 

seems the lights are too low for the matradee and reservation team to realize the trashy dress -- but then maybe Buckhead is changing, we are more old school and will enjoy Bones next time

Not good for business travelers. They do not do separate checks required for our expense reports. Service is rushed, at the end of the meal the staff hovers over you checking receipts in front of you for the tips. Dirty dishes, with dried food from last person. Might just be a bad night.

10 star service! Never will have to wait for someone. Great menu but don't forget the specials! Waiter advised of specials which was practically another full menu! Everything was perfect and made special! Piano bar is a nice touch too! Felt very old school rat pack!

The picture did not do it justice!  I went for an event and wanted to try the best steak they had.  The waitstaff (who all were super helpful) made sure that I tried the ribeye.  I was NOT disappointed.  It was tender and juicy and didnt need much of anything on it.  It was already flavorful, right out the gate.  I did have a salad and some potatoes, but that wasnt what I came for!  The Lyonnaise potatoes were a bit sweet for me, not sure why, but I am used to having more salt or garlic, but not sweet.  I think that I have had Mortons too many times and I am accustomed to a certain flavor of potato, but it was definitely not a deal breaker.  And again... I came for steak!  I would most definitely go back!  Also, you could smoke cigars at the bar, which I liked because I enjoy cigars and a good beer too, that was great for the ambience!

I liked this place but there were factors that were unacceptable for the scale of the restaurant. 
Starting at our reservation, it was at 9:30pm with 7 people but were weren't seated until 10:30pm. There is no waiting area so we were standing in the bar/ dining area for an hour. They also allow smoking which in that crowded place was suffocating. 
The live piano playing was beautiful and set a nice mood for the dark atmosphere. 
Once seated i noticed one of my friends glasses was broken and cracked all the way down the cup and I am glad she didn't drink from it because it would've cut her mouth badly. 
We ordered a bottle of Stella Rosa moscato for $42. Which if you go to a grocery store, is $12. 
The prices were expensive but sadly I can't say the food was worth the prices. Everything was good but not amazing.
I personally wouldn't go back due to the negatives of my experience.

Make reservations! Definitely an old school style steak house with the large pepper grinders and service! Ribeye was deeeelicious cooked perfectly. Lobster Mac and asparagus delicious! Definitely had amazing service and rang in my besties birthday! Desserts and drinks were good!

Ate at Hal's last night (Saturday) with group of 6. I deviated from the rest of the table by not ordering steak and decided to try one of my favorite dishes, the duck a l'orange. I am someone who often will add extra salt to my dishes, but the duck was so salty that I couldn't even eat it. (I see that another reviewer had a similar experience 10 days ago). Our attentive waiter noticed and immediately offered to bring my second choice instead; the veal marsala. He got my replacement dish out quickly.  It too was extremely salty, and far from tender; unusual for veal.  Since my companions were almost finished, I just had him box it to bring home for my teenagers and dog. 
On the other hand, my gumbo was excellent, as were the vegetable sides and my wife's crab salad. 
Atmosphere was extremely noisy with loud music overwhelming the full boisterous crowd. 
Saturday night at Hal's...
Excellent food and great service.  I love the concept.  I wish there was more bar space or other first come first serve space.  Name is wacky AF, like there's at least one extra word in it.

I have always loved the food at Hal's. On yesterday November 11th I had a birthday dinner there. I booked a 20 seat table weeks before time. All 20 of my party members were there and ready to sit at 8 pm. I asked the host (male, latino, gray jacket) when would our table be available. He stated your party has to be here. I replied to him that all 20 of us are here and then he stated, angrily, "I don't see 20 people". I again replied that we are all here. He then ignored me. 

 All while this was going on two individuals from my party sat at the bar. This was their first time meeting each other. They had drinks. After their drinks were done the bartender brought back one check and my two party members paid. After observing the receipt they noticed charges that were not theirs. The bartender not only charged the two individuals jointly she charged a random man's food on their check. Her response was all three of you looked like you were here together. After going back and forth for over 20 minutes a manager came and fixed the check. 

At exactly 8:34 I asked the host again when would the table be ready? The host again stated that he needed to see 20 people. Mind you, my entire party had been ready at 8 pm. I stated to him again that all of my party was there and some people were just at the bar upstairs. At around 8:42 two young ladies walked up to me and said that my table was ready. I asked them who was the host at the host stand, they both laughed after I stated that he was extremely rude and short with me. They stated that he was always rude. 

We dined and our waiters were all attentive and great. The food was awesome as always. After I finished my meal I had some steak and Brussels sprouts leftover. I asked one of the waiters that was helping our waiter for a box. He volunteered to box up my food. My food never came back from the kitchen. I let the waiter know that my food never came back out. The waiter then comped my meal​.

I want to reiterate that my waiter was awesome, the food was good, and we enjoyed our time ONCE WE SAT DOWN TO EAT outside of my food being lost. I want also stress that the way the bartender and especially the male host handled us was unacceptable and does not represent the level of service expected from an establishment such as Hal's. The host was extremely short tempered, unprofessional, disinterested in providing good service.

This place is about going in with the right expectation and having them completely met. 

Dark, mysterious, rich, old Atlanta steakhouse. 

No nonsense when it comes to the food. Classics, great char on the steaks, lots of butter in the side dishes. 

Martinis in big glasses, service like an old school NOLA restaurant in the French Quarter, and zero rushing. 

It's an institution for a reason, and well earned.
I have been to Hal's about 15 times and it's great every time. Make sure to ask for the appetizers and lobster mashed potatoes that aren't in the menu.
The food was amazing. The texture and flavor were high quality. I had an amazing date here. The service was top notch

On Wednesday evening this was a bustling place....loud music, crowded, no masks. The bar and dining room are combined and they smoke cigars in the bar. 

The grilled oysters were great and I would say the 22oz bone in prime ribeye was out of this world enjoyable. A great piece of meat! The side of mashed potatoes was soso and too tiny to be taken seriously...some improvement possible here. The creme brulee again hit the spot. 

I expected a quieter old school steakhouse but this is more a ruff and tumble bar/restaurant with some patrons visibly strained beyond their comfort level to satisfy the dress code. My overall rating is heavily weighed toward the steak which was one of the few truly great ones for my 2021.

photos.caption: Out of this world delicious 22oz bone-in prime ribeye, medium.

comment.text: This is our most favorite steak spot in Buckhead! Great seafood and service every time.
